paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: The paper discusses the TTR gene variant TTRS52P, its association with amyloidosis, and provides insights into penetrance data.

patients.demographics: British family, specific details not provided
patients.phenotype: ATTR amyloidosis leading to death with cardiomyopathy during the third decade

individual_records.phenotype_details: ATTR amyloidosis leading to death with cardiomyopathy
individual_records.evidence_sentence: We selected this particular TTR variant following our clinical experience with a British family in whom this mutation was associated with the highly penetrant development of ATTR amyloidosis leading to death with cardiomyopathy during the third decade.

functional_data.summary: The TTRS52P variant is associated with significant amyloid deposition and is linked to the pathogenesis of ATTR amyloidosis.

variants.segregation_data: The variant segregates with disease in the reported family.
variants.evidence_level: Strong evidence based on clinical observation and functional studies.
variants.additional_notes: The variant is known to be prevalent in certain populations and is associated with a high penetrance of disease.
key_quotes: The most prevalent pathogenic allele, encoding TTRV122I, is carried by 3–4% of African American individuals.
We selected this particular TTR variant following our clinical experience with a British family in whom this mutation was associated with the highly penetrant development of ATTR amyloidosis.

extraction_metadata.notes: The extraction was straightforward as the relevant variant data was clearly presented in the text.
